summary: Is it weird that I am hyped because "Ice" is returning to Winterfell now that Jaime is going North with Widow's Wail and Brienne...
body:
Is it weird that I am hyped because “Ice” is returning to Winterfell now that Jaime is going North with Widow’s Wail and Brienne has Oathkeeper? It gets me sentimental because reminds me of Ned.

You think Jaime will rename it?

Will Sam kill white walkers with Heartsbane or give it to someone else?

Is Arya’s dagger enough to kill a ww?

Why Jon didn’t say in King’s Landing that Valyrian steel kills ww?

summary: How can Sansa be so diplomatic??? I can’t even pretend to like a gift from my aunt. Like if I were Sansa I’d have seized power...
body:
How can Sansa be so diplomatic??? I can’t even pretend to like a gift from my aunt. Like if I were Sansa I’d have seized power and either attacked Daenerys’ army or destroyed the North so Daenerys couldn’t get it.


W0W I’d be a terrible monarch

summary: lmao out of curiosity I looked at the notes of your last post about dany and arya and someone wrote that s*nsa is the key to the...
question: lmao out of curiosity I looked at the notes of your last post about dany and arya and someone wrote that s*nsa is the key to the iron throne, she is elizabeth of york.. she is the smartest character in the books and show and dany is a coward, among other things.. They seriously lost it.
answer:
I just…. 

I have nothing against Sansa as the character she is portrayed in the story but her stans have completely warped and twisted her to the point where it’s no longer canon. They have confused fan fiction with what is actually happening. I partly blame D&D for this mess because they decided to segue her away from the Eyrie and back to the North in order to keep her storyline relevant. In doing so, she looks more important than she actually is. Everything from her fanbase thinking she saved Jon in the Battle of the Bastards (when really she ran to Littlefinger because Jon wasn’t listening to her and he came up with the military strategy) to them convincing themselves she’s the most important Stark when Bran literally exists to thinking her older brother is destined to fall in love with her when he finds out he’s a Targaryen as if that cancels out being raised as siblings to believing Dany is the true evil when the ultimate antagonist is quite noticeably Cersei and the White Walkers to this nonsense Queen in the North theory. It’s a damn mess of illogical conclusions. I understand character development and Sansa has definitely grown from the timid, naive girl she was to a strong young woman who is fiercely protective of her family and the North BUT this story will not morph into the Sansa chronicles. No matter how much they desperately want it to.

title: Jon and Theon's Frantic Humping Spree - cleromancy - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description: “Fuck,” Theon whispers, hoarse. I’m going to die. He’s going to suck my life out through my dick. His breath shudders out and he grits his teeth, bracing himself harder against the refrigerator to keep from sliding down.

summary: we take our daily breath and thank our unlucky stars - janie_tangerine - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive...
title: we take our daily breath and thank our unlucky stars - janie_tangerine - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
“My lord –”

“I liked it better when you called me bastard,” Jon mutters, and you don’t even know what to say.

“I’m sorry,” you whisper. You hope he understands that it’s not just about that. It’s about everything.

“I’m sorry,” you whisper. You hope he understands that it’s not just about that. It’s about everything.

summary: VERY TL;DR but it’s about two amazing
body:
VERY TL;DR but it’s about two amazing

Queens (wolf and dragon)

The tension between Sansa and Dany…

(This is really long but I hope you read )

Okay, from what we have seen from that very brief teaser, we already know that there is a lot of tension between Sansa and Dany and from what I have already seen on here, there are a lot of people who are trying to put them against each other. Two very strong and powerful women who have both through all kinds of different hells in both of their lives. Their strength comes from those very traumatic experiences and now they have come together for one common goal. To defeat the Night King and save Westeros.

Now it is completely understandable as to why there is so much tension between these two.

Sansa has seen a lot of bullshit from a lot of people who believe that they have a right to that throne and especially those who arrive in Winterfell. I mean the last time a royal who was on the throne came, her family were all still alive and she was just a young girl who didn’t know any better. Well this time it is completely different. She has been through too fucking much to just trust this unknown Queen from across the sea, who goes by the Targaryen name, and name she grew to fear and hate and just willingly trust her. And in her words, that was once said by her father long ago to the man who was King says, “ Winterfell is yours, your grace” there is so much to be said as to what Sansa is feeling right now and what she is thinking as she is staring down Daenerys Targaryen. Of course she skeptical and passively aggressive towards her. She grew up believing she was the Mad King’s daughter and seeks to destroy those in her way and claim Westeros/the Seven Kingdoms to herself. And right now they are facing a bigger and greater enemy that is threatening everything that they hold dear.So of course Sansa doesn’t trust her just like Jon did when he first met Dany. Sansa needs to get to see Dany the way Jon has seen her. Not this Mad Queen or ruthless ruler but a woman who can be kind and worth bending the knee for. Sansa doesn’t have to give Dany anything. Sansa deserves the right to protect her home from a queen she has still yet to trust. Sansa just wants what Jon wants to protect their family’s home and keep them safe. Sansa and Dany just need the same opportunity that Dany had with Jon. The time to understand one another. And hopefully they can do that.

Now with Dany. She too has been through too much to have to be pitted against another strong and powerful potential queen. Dany grew up isolated and alone, running for her entire life. Sold to a war lord for his army by her own fucking brother and has been through just about the same amount of fucked up shit as Sansa has. She has never been to Westeros so she also, right now, doesn’t know a lot about the system she wants to rule. About the certain customs to do in a situation like this one. I mean the threat from the Night King is serious and she has already lost a child, her dragon, to the white walkers. She arrives to Winterfell with Jon and meets his family for the first time. Not as the queen who orders you to bend the knee for her but as an ally willing to help in the present crisis. Who, like Jon sees the impending threat coming from the wall. Even the way she walks towards Sansa says something about her intentions and the way she stands with Jon you can see that Dany is just trying to be sincere. Dany, throughout the show has always been maternal and caring towards all the women around her. I mean with her hand maids when she was Khaleesi, to the women she protected from being raped by Drogo’s blood riders ( a mistake which she paid for by the way - Mirri Mhaz Dihurr) and all the way to Missandei. Dany isn’t trying to steal Winterfell away or threaten anyone especially those who Jon cares about. She knows how deeply loyal and brave he is and she wouldn’t threaten them. And what happens when Sansa learns that this woman saved her brother’s life? And that she too has lost those she has cared about to the Lannister’s? Or the fact that Tyrion, the only Lannister who was kind to her, is her Hand? Sansa does not know who she is yet and I hope that changes in this upcoming season.

And it’s as if Jon would let them do anything to each other. He cares for both of these women. And he just wants to protect them.

I really hope that the hostility between them passes and that they become trusting allies. Dany and Sansa should help and support one another and not he pitted against each other. Dany and Sansa can find common ground and learn to trust one another when they share their experiences.

We’ve literally only seen a few seconds of a final season to an amazing show so this is just what I think so… call me an optimist. Also can we please get over the strong woman vs strong woman fight? Like can we get past pitting women against each other? Women should support one another not tear each other down. Especially those who have been through what they both have been through so like please… seriously.

Or the fact that Tyrion, the only Lannister who was kind to her, is her Hand? Sansa does not know who she is yet and I hope that changes in this upcoming season.

And it’s as if Jon would let them do anything to each other. He cares for both of these women. And he just wants to protect them.

I really hope that the hostility between them passes and that they become trusting allies. Dany and Sansa should help and support one another and not he pitted against each other. Dany and Sansa can find common ground and learn to trust one another when they share their experiences.

We’ve literally only seen a few seconds of a final season to an amazing show so this is just what I think so… call me an optimist. Also can we please get over the strong woman vs strong woman fight? Like can we get past pitting women against each other? Women should support one another not tear each other down. Especially those who have been through what they both have been through so like please… seriously.

trail.content_raw:
VERY TL;DR but it’s about two amazing

Queens (wolf and dragon)

The tension between Sansa and Dany…

(This is really long but I hope you read )

Okay, from what we have seen from that very brief teaser, we already know that there is a lot of tension between Sansa and Dany and from what I have already seen on here, there are a lot of people who are trying to put them against each other. Two very strong and powerful women who have both through all kinds of different hells in both of their lives. Their strength comes from those very traumatic experiences and now they have come together for one common goal. To defeat the Night King and save Westeros.

Now it is completely understandable as to why there is so much tension between these two.

Sansa has seen a lot of bullshit from a lot of people who believe that they have a right to that throne and especially those who arrive in Winterfell. I mean the last time a royal who was on the throne came, her family were all still alive and she was just a young girl who didn’t know any better. Well this time it is completely different. She has been through too fucking much to just trust this unknown Queen from across the sea, who goes by the Targaryen name, and name she grew to fear and hate and just willingly trust her. And in her words, that was once said by her father long ago to the man who was King says, “ Winterfell is yours, your grace” there is so much to be said as to what Sansa is feeling right now and what she is thinking as she is staring down Daenerys Targaryen. Of course she skeptical and passively aggressive towards her. She grew up believing she was the Mad King’s daughter and seeks to destroy those in her way and claim Westeros/the Seven Kingdoms to herself. And right now they are facing a bigger and greater enemy that is threatening everything that they hold dear.So of course Sansa doesn’t trust her just like Jon did when he first met Dany. Sansa needs to get to see Dany the way Jon has seen her. Not this Mad Queen or ruthless ruler but a woman who can be kind and worth bending the knee for. Sansa doesn’t have to give Dany anything. Sansa deserves the right to protect her home from a queen she has still yet to trust. Sansa just wants what Jon wants to protect their family’s home and keep them safe. Sansa and Dany just need the same opportunity that Dany had with Jon. The time to understand one another. And hopefully they can do that.

Now with Dany. She too has been through too much to have to be pitted against another strong and powerful potential queen. Dany grew up isolated and alone, running for her entire life. Sold to a war lord for his army by her own fucking brother and has been through just about the same amount of fucked up shit as Sansa has. She has never been to Westeros so she also, right now, doesn’t know a lot about the system she wants to rule. About the certain customs to do in a situation like this one. I mean the threat from the Night King is serious and she has already lost a child, her dragon, to the white walkers. She arrives to Winterfell with Jon and meets his family for the first time. Not as the queen who orders you to bend the knee for her but as an ally willing to help in the present crisis. Who, like Jon sees the impending threat coming from the wall. Even the way she walks towards Sansa says something about her intentions and the way she stands with Jon you can see that Dany is just trying to be sincere. Dany, throughout the show has always been maternal and caring towards all the women around her. I mean with her hand maids when she was Khaleesi, to the women she protected from being raped by Drogo’s blood riders ( a mistake which she paid for by the way - Mirri Mhaz Dihurr) and all the way to Missandei. Dany isn’t trying to steal Winterfell away or threaten anyone especially those who Jon cares about. She knows how deeply loyal and brave he is and she wouldn’t threaten them. And what happens when Sansa learns that this woman saved her brother’s life? And that she too has lost those she has cared about to the Lannister’s? Or the fact that Tyrion, the only Lannister who was kind to her, is her Hand? Sansa does not know who she is yet and I hope that changes in this upcoming season.

And it’s as if Jon would let them do anything to each other. He cares for both of these women. And he just wants to protect them.

I really hope that the hostility between them passes and that they become trusting allies. Dany and Sansa should help and support one another and not he pitted against each other. Dany and Sansa can find common ground and learn to trust one another when they share their experiences.

We’ve literally only seen a few seconds of a final season to an amazing show so this is just what I think so… call me an optimist. Also can we please get over the strong woman vs strong woman fight? Like can we get past pitting women against each other? Women should support one another not tear each other down. Especially those who have been through what they both have been through so like please… seriously.

Especially those who have been through what they both have been through so like please… seriously.
